newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midcontinent diesel, unleaded diffs steady.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midcontinent diesel, unleaded diffs steady.

text.p: U.S. Midcontinent unleaded gasoline and diesel fuel differentials were unchanged, leaving prices to track futures lower on Friday, traders said.
Traders expected basis in the Group Three and Chicago markets to reverse course and move higher next week after easing this week on weaker differentials and lower futures prices.
"I think things will be firming up next week," one trader said earlier in the day.
Low sulphur diesel for March deliveries was talked 5.75/6.0 cents a gallon over NYMEX April heating oil in Chicago and 4.0/4.25 cents over the print in Group Three.
High sulphur diesel also was steady at 3.0 cents a gallon over the print in Chicago and 2.25 cents over in Group Three.
The Williams Pipeline system, a key barometer of inventories in the Group Three market, reported a 36-day supply of low sulphur diesel and 25-day supply of unleaded on hand, traders said.
